message: Hi I'm wondering if someone knows some good resources on writing project specs.. I am a freelance developer more focused on actual development and less focused on tech specs.. Im involved in a proj where have to write technical specs (& functional req specs) and have absolutely no idea where to start.. any good site or sample or book you would advise ?
Gallons of ink and billions of pixels have been spilled on this subject. What have you looked at so far?
You talking like UML specifications of something else?
@adnan i like Joel Spolsky's series on writing specs: http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/fog0000000036.html
a lot of writing on agile processes in software is about specs, when they're appropriate and when they're too specific, and what to use instead.
so some of that might apply depending on what kind of organization you're in and what you're doing there
i like The Art of Agile Development as an exploration of that toolkit http://oreilly.com/catalog/9780596527679/
@markpasc thanks alot will have a look
@vmbrasseur well said about billions of pixels.. I have looked on Google and found some info which is.. either too vague or too generic to apply.. Im involved in a web-app..
@vmbrasseur someone recommended "Rapid development: Taming Wild Software Schedules"..

Another path: To become a good writer, you must become a good reader. Read stuff other people write - on the subject and on other things. Everything I know about writing has been taught to me by a piece of paper and ink -- or by having the output of a computer hit my retina.

Scott Berkun's "Making Things Happen" is a good place to start. It's more of a general "software project management lifecycle" work but does cover a lot about specs. http://openlibrary.org/books/OL10781040M/Making_Things_Happen
